TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {164245=28 July 2014, 165055=Copyright Security-Database 2006-2015 - Powered by themself ;) in 0.3478s , 163787=06 July 2015, 1480=The RPC code generator in Samba 3.x before 3.4.16, 3.5.x before 3.5.14, and 3.6.x before 3.6.4 does not implement validation of an array length in a manner consistent with validation of array memory allocation, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted RPC call.}
textBeforeTable: this. This Alert is flagged as TOP 25 Common Weakness Enumeration from CWE/SANS. For more information, you can read Executive Summary 10- CVE-2012-1182   OVAL : Open Vulnerability and Assessment Language CWE : Common Weakness Enumeration CAPEC : Common Pattern Enumeration CVE : Common Vulnerability Enumeration Contacts About us About US Blog CVSS Calculator OVAL Definitions OVAL Repository CPE : Common Plateform Enumeration DPE : Default Password Enumeration CAPEC : Common Pattern Enumeration CWE : Common Weakness Enumeration vDNA : Vulnerability DNA API Documentation vDNA : Vulnerability DNA API Resources HP VMware US-CERT Gentoo
textAfterTable: Definition Id: oval:org.mitre.oval:def:21345   Oval ID: oval:org.mitre.oval:def:21345 Title: RHSA-2012:0465: samba security update (Critical) Description: The RPC code generator in Samba 3.x before 3.4.16, 3.5.x before 3.5.14, and 3.6.x before 3.6.4 does not implement validation of an array length in a manner consistent with validation of array memory allocation, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted RPC call. Family: unix Class: patch Reference(s): RHSA-2012:0465-02 CESA-2012:0465 CVE-2012-1182 Version: 4 Platform(s): Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5 Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 CentOS Linux 5 CentOS Linux 6 Product(s): samba Definition Synopsis: Operation system section Redhat 5 or Centos 5 release The operating system installed on the system is Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5 AND The operating system installed on the system is CentOS Linux 5.x
